definition: seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]

sentences.english: Do you think I should take this clock or the pair of bottles？
sentences.chinese: 你想我是買個座鐘還是買這對瓶子？

sentences.english: He gave me a small clock hooded with a glass cover.
sentences.chinese: 他送給我一個帶玻璃罩的小座鐘。

sentences.english: This clock carries a full-year guarantee.
A clock and two vases stood on the mantelpiece.
sentences.chinese: 壁爐臺上擺着一個座鐘和兩個花瓶。

sentences.english: Just as a timepiece stops in a house that is stricken by lightning.
sentences.chinese: 就像被雷擊中的房子裏一隻座鐘停止了走動。

sentences.english: The clock is a work of art.
Give the clock another couple of winds .
sentences.chinese: 給這座鐘再上兩圈發條。

sentences.english: He accidentally found that the desk clock did not swing its pendulum.
sentences.chinese: 他無意中發現座鐘不搖擺了。

sentences.english: The clock gains one minute a day.
Also, a grandfather clock would look great in the den.
sentences.chinese: 還有，書房裏放一盞大座鐘會很漂亮的。

sentences.english: Hushed. The clock even seemed smaller.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連那座鐘都看起來小了些。

sentences.english: A large pendulum swung back and forth inside the grandfather clock.
sentences.chinese: 在老式落地座鐘裏面有一個大鐘擺在擺來擺去。

sentences.english: There is a clock on the wall.
This clock can only ring the hours.
sentences.chinese: 這座鐘只能每小時報時一次。

sentences.english: They hoisted the clock into place on top of the building.
sentences.chinese: 他們將那座鐘吊起來，安裝在建築物的頂端。

definition: Van Cleef & Arpels (French luxury jewelry company)
perpetual calendar/ten thousand year calendar/Islamic calendar introduced to Yuan China by Jamal al-Din 紮馬剌丁|扎马剌丁
variant of 表盤|表盘[biao3 pan2]/watch face
balance (of a watch or clock)/balance wheel
brass (alloy of copper 銅|铜[tong2] and zinc 鋅|锌[xin1])

pinyin: Shi1 hua2 luo4 shi4 qi2 shui3 jing1
